adjectives.description: draconic (comparative more draconic, superlative most draconic)

entries.meaning: Relating to or suggestive of dragons.
examples: There are amongst the constellations four great draconic or serpent-like forms.

description: From the Athenian lawmaker Draco, known for making harsh laws.

adjectives.description: draconic (comparative more draconic, superlative most draconic)

entries.meaning: (rare, dated, has been replaced by "draconian") Very severe or strict; draconian.
examples: […]  they no land / Doomed to bewail the blasphemy of laws / Making kings' rights divine, by some Draconic clause.
